title: gastownui-design-critique
description:
P0 issues from Gas Town UI Design Critique (2026-01-10).

Three critical UX issues identified using Nielsen's heuristics:
1. Header Height Inconsistency - Pages use inline headers instead of PageHeader
2. Navigation Scroll Affordance - No visual indicators when nav overflows
3. Theme Toggle Discoverability - Theme selector buried in Settings

All testing uses Claude Chrome MCP tools only.

title: P0: Migrate pages to PageHeader component for consistent headers
description:
## Problem
Pages use inline headers instead of the existing `PageHeader` component, causing inconsistent header heights across the application.

**Nielsen Heuristic Violations:**
- #4: Consistency & Standards - Headers behave differently across pages
- #8: Aesthetic & Minimalist Design - Visual jarring from height changes during navigation

**Affected Pages:**
- Dashboard (DashboardLayout.svelte - uses py-3, has status pill)
- Health (health/+page.svelte - inline with StatusIndicator)
- Mail (mail/+page.svelte - inline with compose button)
- Agents (agents/+page.svelte - inline with filter dropdown)
- Logs (LogsLayout.svelte - two-row header with filters)

## Solution
Migrate all pages to use the existing `PageHeader` component with:
- Option A: Direct migration for simple pages
- Option B: Composition pattern for pages with filters
- Add CSS variable `--header-height` for dynamic positioning

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] All pages use PageHeader component (no inline sticky headers)
- [ ] Header height is consistent across all pages (verify with screenshots)
- [ ] Actions slot works for buttons, dropdowns, status indicators
- [ ] Breadcrumbs display correctly when provided
- [ ] LiveCount badge shows with correct status colors
- [ ] Sticky behavior works on scroll
- [ ] Mobile responsive (text truncation, spacing correct)
- [ ] Filter bar (if present) uses CSS variable for positioning

## Testing (Claude Chrome MCP Only)
1. Navigate to each page at mobile (390px), tablet (768px), desktop (1400px)
2. Take screenshots comparing header heights across pages
3. Verify sticky behavior by scrolling on each page
4. Check filter bar positioning on Logs and Agents pages
5. Validate actions slot with buttons and dropdowns
6. Test breadcrumb rendering where applicable

title: P0: Add scroll fade indicators to sidebar navigation
description:
## Problem
No visual indicator when navigation content overflows the viewport. Users cannot see if there's more content below.

**Nielsen Heuristic Violations:**
- #1: Visibility of System Status - No indication of scrollable content
- #4: Consistency & Standards - Platform scroll indicators expected

**Issues Identified:**
1. No scroll affordance on desktop sidebar
2. Safari dynamic toolbar: `100vh` doesn't account for collapsing address bar
3. Missing safe area padding on notched devices

## Solution
1. Add scroll fade indicators to Sidebar.svelte:
   - Top fade when scrolled down
   - Bottom fade when more content exists
   - hasOverflow check to prevent fades on non-scrollable content
   - ResizeObserver for dynamic content updates

2. Use dynamic viewport units (dvh):
   - Add `.h-dvh` and `.min-h-dvh` utilities to app.css
   - Update mobile drawer to use `h-dvh` instead of `h-screen`

3. Add safe area padding:
   - Verify `pb-safe` exists in CSS
   - Add to sidebar footer

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Top fade appears only when scrolled down
- [ ] Bottom fade appears only when more content exists below
- [ ] No fades visible when content doesn't overflow
- [ ] Fades update on window resize
- [ ] Fades update when sidebar collapses/expands
- [ ] Mobile Safari: drawer height correct with toolbar visible/hidden
- [ ] iPhone X+: content doesn't clip behind home indicator

## Testing (Claude Chrome MCP Only)
1. Resize browser to force sidebar overflow
2. Verify top fade appears after scrolling down
3. Verify bottom fade disappears at end of scroll
4. Test sidebar collapse/expand - fades should recalculate
5. Test at mobile viewport with simulated Safari toolbar
6. Verify no fades when nav items fit without scrolling

title: P0: Add theme toggle to sidebar footer with shared store
description:
## Problem
Theme selector only accessible in Settings (/settings). Users must navigate away from current context to change themes.

**Nielsen Heuristic Violations:**
- #7: Flexibility & Efficiency - Power users can't quickly toggle theme
- #3: User Control & Freedom - Requires leaving current context

## Solution
1. Create shared theme store (`src/lib/stores/theme.ts`):
   - Single source of truth for theme state
   - localStorage persistence with error handling
   - System theme change listener (prefers-color-scheme)
   - Screen reader announcements on change

2. Create ThemeToggle component (`src/lib/components/ThemeToggle.svelte`):
   - Segmented control with dark/light/system options
   - Compact mode (single cycling icon) for collapsed sidebar
   - Proper ARIA roles (radiogroup, radio, aria-checked)
   - Focus visible styles for keyboard navigation

3. Integrate into Sidebar footer:
   - Full toggle when sidebar expanded
   - Compact icon when sidebar collapsed

4. Update Settings page to use shared store (remove duplicate logic)

5. Add flash prevention script to app.html `<head>`

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Theme persists across page refresh
- [ ] Theme syncs between Settings page and sidebar toggle
- [ ] System theme changes reflected when 'system' selected
- [ ] Works in incognito mode (graceful degradation)
- [ ] Keyboard navigation works (Tab, Enter, Space)
- [ ] Screen reader announces theme changes
- [ ] No flash of wrong theme on initial load
- [ ] Collapsed sidebar shows correct compact icon
- [ ] Expanded sidebar shows full segmented control

## Testing (Claude Chrome MCP Only)
1. Toggle theme in sidebar, verify localStorage updated
2. Refresh page, verify theme persists
3. Toggle in sidebar, navigate to Settings, verify state synced
4. Toggle in Settings, return to sidebar, verify state synced
5. Select 'system', change browser dark mode, verify app updates
6. Test keyboard navigation (Tab to toggle, Enter/Space to activate)
7. Test with screen reader (VoiceOver: Cmd+F5 on Mac)
8. Hard refresh with cache clear, verify no flash of wrong theme
